metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10067 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
magick/memory.c in ImageMagick before 6.9.4-5 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (application crash) via vectors involving "toomany exceptions," which trigger a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3').
